text: @FEMA and the @FCC will conduct a nationwide test of the Emergency Alert System (EAS) and the Wireless Emergency Alerts (WEA), in two parts & scheduled to begin around 2:20pm ET today. fema.gov/press-release/20230â€¦

Please join me in celebrating the 99th birthday of my fellow Georgian, President #JimmyCarter. From a peanut farmer in Plains to a peacemaker on the world stage, his legacy of humility & dedication to human rights continues to be an inspiration. Happy Birthday, President Carter!

I led opposition to HR 4368, the FY24 Ag-RuralDevelopment-FDA funding bill. It was defeated by a vote of 191-237. I outlined the detrimental effects it would have on families, communities & industries that affect the lives of every American. piped.video/watch?v=MFObNAuxâ€¦

This week I met w/ the @gsbacomm. We discussed the need for robust federal funding for Title I schools, child nutrition, mental health & students w/ disabilities. Congress should continue to be a strong supporter of schools who work hard to provide the best outcomes for students.

.@FVSU has been awarded $398K from the National Science Foundation to encourage & support underrepresented students to pursue science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) higher education degrees and careers. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

On Yom Kippur, our Jewish community observes a solemn day of atonement and reflection over the past year. It is a time dedicated to making amends and a reminder of the power of forgiveness. Wishing all who observe a blessed Yom Kippur and a meaningful fast.

If you or someone you know is facing an emotional or mental health crisis, you are not alone. You can always call the 988 Lifeline for free, confidential support. 988 offers 24/7 access to trained crisis counselors who can help people experiencing distress.samhsa.gov/find-help/988

Lumpkin, GA will receive $34K through USDA to purchase communications equipment for 7 vehicles in the Law Enforcement Dept. I'll continue to work to ensure that programs are adequately funded so that the federal govt remains a dependable partner for our first responders.

To our brave veterans who served in combat & were discharged from service between 9/11/01 and 10/1/13, you are eligible to file for VA healthcare under the #PACTAct. Sign up today to secure your coverage! VA.gov/PACT. Open enrollment ends at 11:59 PM EST on 9/30/2023.

These men are eminently qualified for these roles & have earned respect & admiration for their decades of service in defense of our nation. I urge Senate Rs and Ds to come together to quickly confirm the hundreds of remaining military nominations.

I'm pleased that the Senate was able to confirm the nominations of Generals C.Q. Brown & Randy George to serve as the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff & Army Chief of Staff, respectively. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I enjoyed meeting with so many #HeadStart leaders from Middle & Southwest Georgia today to talk about how important Head Start is to child development. I will continue to work hard in Congress to make sure Head Start has the resources it needs to help Georgiaâ€™s families.

September is #PassportAwarenessMonth. Remember to check your passport expiration date regularly and apply for your passport 6-9 months before expiration or travel! Learn more at travel.state.gov/passports.

Hurricane season started in June and goes through November. With reports of Tropical Storm Idalia in the Gulf, now is a good time to make sure you are prepared! You can visit my website for tips. bishop.house.gov/resources-sâ€¦

The #MarchOnWashington for Jobs & Freedom was a pivotal moment in our nationâ€™s history for me & so many others. I would like to commend Columbus, GA native, Phillip Shoultz, for organizing a concert commemorating the 60th anniversary of the March. #March60 piped.video/watch?v=rNi2-Wxuâ€¦

The letter urges USPS to keep the Macon P&DC open so that it can continue to process local mail & deliver both letters & packages to Middle Georgians on-time. It also asks Qs about the potential loss of postal jobs so that people fully understand the consequences of any changes.

Rep. Austin Scott (R-GA-08) and I sent a letter to Postmaster General Louis DeJoy regarding the proposal to transform the Macon Processing & Distribution facility (Macon P&DC) into a Local Processing Center. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce a $315K award to the Columbus Fire & EMS Dept! Through the Assistance to Firefighters Grant program, we can help depts get up-to-date equipment they need to best protect the communities they serve & the lives of our first responders. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce 2 awards totaling $1.1M for the Crawford County & Grady County Fire Departments! I will continue to fight for these vital resources so that our departments are well staffed, trained, and equipped. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Happy Birthday to First Lady Rosalynn Carter, whose compassion & service has improved the lives of so many. Her legacy continues to inspire others, like those at @RCICaregiving which provides resources to ppl who care for loved ones w/ Alzheimerâ€™s disease. #MrsCarterMakingHistory

1 year ago, the #InflationReductionAct went into effect. It reduced #insulin to $35 for Medicare beneficiaries. But we shouldnâ€™t stop there! There are 85K people w/ diabetes in GA02. I'll continue working to find ways to  save families money on Rx's. cms.gov/inflation-reduction-â€¦

Did you receive COVID-19 tests that you did not order? The @FTC is warning Medicare beneficiaries to be wary of a new scam targeting them. Learn more & how to protect yourself here: consumer.ftc.gov/consumer-alâ€¦

One year ago, the Honoring Our #PACTAct was signed into law, making it easier for toxic-exposed veterans to receive full access to VA care & benefits. The deadline to submit an intent to file for benefits backdated to Aug. 10, 2022, has been extended to Monday!

Were you exposed to toxic burn pits, Agent Orange, or other toxins during your military service? Thereâ€™s still time to file a claim for benefits backdated from last August under the #PACTAct. Apply by August 9th!
va.gov/resources/the-pact-acâ€¦

I'm thrilled to announce a $224,500 #EmergencyRuralHealthCare Grant that @MercerYou will utilize to establish a new primary care facility in Reynolds, GA! Every American deserves quality, affordable health care close to home, regardless of zip code. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce a $105K Assistance to Firefighters Grant to the city of Montezuma! The first responders of Montezuma serve with pride & bravery. I'm proud that my work in Congress supports these volunteers who risk their lives to protect us. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

(5/5) These investments in #ruralbroadband increase access to health care through tele-health, improve education outcomes in our schools and universities, create jobs & grow our economy, and improve the quality of life of Middle and Southwest Georgians. #RuralBroadbandDay

(4/5) The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw included $65 billion for broadband development across the nation, including a $36 million #ReConnect program loan for seven underserved counties in Middle Georgia.

(3/5) These resources continue to provide students better internet access for their education. Building on that success, Congressman Bishop supported federal funds to help families afford high-speed internet via the Affordable Connectivity Program fcc.gov/acp.

(2/5) Through ARPA's Emergency Connectivity Fund, 30 school districts and 5 library systems in GA02 received a total of $20,785,860 for #broadband connectivity and devices, directly funded by Congress. These helped close the connectivity gap during the pandemic.
ðŸ›œðŸ§µ(1/5) Happy #RuralBroadbandDay! Over the past two years, Congress has made historic investments to connect every American family to the internet, especially in our rural communities.

Rep. Bishopâ€™s DC office is accepting Internship applications for the fall! This paid position runs Sept.-Dec. & allows interns to learn about the legislative process & other functions of a House office. Those from Middle & SW GA are encouraged to apply! bishop.house.gov/resources-sâ€¦

I cosponsored HR 4895, the Lowering Drug Costs for American Families Act, which extends the drug price negotiation program to Americans w/ private healthcare plans, which could save families 100s in health costs. I will continue working to lower drug costs for all Americans.

Time is running out to register for the #MilitaryFamilySummit2023! Our Keynote Speaker this year is Gen. Gary Brito, Commanding General of the Army Training & Doctrine Command. He's responsible for building a highly trained, disciplined & fit U.S. Army. bishop.house.gov/CMFC-2023suâ€¦

I supported the Securing Growth & Robust Leadership in American Aviation Act. This bipartisan bill will help keep us safe & includes important consumer protections, will broaden the aviation industry workforce & help us stay on the cutting edge of tech.
bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I voted against the FY24 Military Construction-Veterans Affairs funding bill because it fundamentally threatens the very fabric of the commitment we have made to our service members and veterans. Read more in my press release below. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦
(2/2) Those volunteering to serve & sacrifice for our country should have equal opportunity in our military, and we must do our best to ensure their well-being when they lay down their uniform.

(1/2) 75 years ago today, President Trumanâ€™s Executive Order desegregated the US Armed Forces. On Monday, I joined the Dept. of Labor via video to commemorate this anniversary. piped.video/watch?v=31ljlcRhâ€¦

I opposed the FY24 THUD bill as well as the FY24 Interior/Environment funding bill. These bills make massive cuts to federal programs that safeguard the countryâ€™s affordable housing, roads, railways, bridges, airports & other critical infrastructure. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I visited the Plummer Home on Saturday. It provides housing to those in need, including our veterans. Congress must be a reliable partner in this effort, and Iâ€™m working hard to support programs that fight homelessness and provide workforce training for those seeking jobs.

Happy #NelsonMandelaInternationalDay! Mandela dedicated his life to dismantling apartheid. His unwavering determination & election as the 1st President of South Africa inspires so many. Today, let's recommit to the values he stood for: compassion, forgiveness & human dignity.

I opposed the 2023 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) and the FY24 Financial Services federal funding bill. Both bills, in their present form, are ultimately harmful and counterproductive to Americaâ€™s well-being and military readiness. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

ATTENTION ALL MILITARY FAMILY MEMBERS:
The time has come to register for the 2023 Military Family Caucus Summit! Visit our webpage to learn more about this important event.

We encourage in-person participation, but virtual registrants are welcome!
bishop.house.gov/CMFC-2023suâ€¦

Today, we celebrate #NationalBlueberryDay & pay tribute to the sweet taste of success & the hard work of our dedicated GA farmers! This month, I hope you take a moment to appreciate these little bursts of flavor that are good for our health & contribute to a thriving ag industry.

Congratulations to President Jimmy Carter and Mrs. Rosalynn Carter on their 77th wedding anniversary! Their love and commitment to one another is a reflection of their compassion for humanity and service to others. @CarterLibrary @RCICaregiving

The #MilitaryFamilySummit2023 is an opportunity for servicemembers, families & experts to meet & discuss how Congress can tackle their unique challenges. This year's theme: Together We Thrive: Strengthening Resilience & Enhancing Well-being in Military Families.

Throughout our nationâ€™s history, Black & Brown Americans have been underrepresented in higher ed, which harms their ability to achieve economic mobility. This ruling will jeopardize opportunities for historically disadvantaged communities across the US.
bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

This weekendâ€™s rallies by a neo-Nazi group are reprehensible and do not reflect the values of our great state. When faced with moments like this, we must not remain silent. Read my full statement here. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

It was a pleasure to meet with the Commander of the @AF_Sustainment, Lt. Gen. Stacey Hawkins. LG Hawkins & I discussed the establishment of the AFSC's Software Engineering Directorate & how it will provide unprecedented software capabilities for Dept. of Defense weapon systems.
I look forward to Indian Prime Minister Modi's address to Congress this afternoon.

I introduced HR 4162, the Land Grant Research Prioritization Act -a bill that would provide land grant universities w/ dedicated access to existing USDA grant funding to enhance AI & mechanization solutions to the challenges facing Americaâ€™s ag producers.bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

#Juneteenth is not only an annual reminder of the end of a dark period in our nationâ€™s history, but a chance to rejoice at how far we have come as a society and contemplate how far we have yet to go.

I opposed the FY24 funding bill for Ag, Rural Development & FDA during consideration by the House Appropriations Cmte. The bill endangers our ability to produce the safest, most abundant & affordable food, fiber & medicine upon which every American relies. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Happy Birthday to the @USArmy! Founded on June 14, 1775, to fight for Americaâ€™s independence, today it's the largest branch of the U.S. Armed Forces. I'm grateful to our brave Soldiers who answer the call to serve & defend our country around the globe. #ARMYBDAY #BeAllYouCanBe

I met w/ the CEO of Anovion Technologies to discuss their new graphite manufacturing facility in Bainbridge. Thanks to incentives in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law & FY22/FY23 funding I secured for Bainbridgeâ€™s industrial park, the facility will create 400 high quality jobs!

I was happy to meet w/ representatives from @IntlPaperCo, which has 17 facilities in GA, including 2 in GA-02! They produce fiber-based products, such as pulp for diapers & tissue. We discussed the ways Congress can help manufacturers create & sustain good-paying, American jobs.
It was a pleasure to meet with representatives from the American Israel Public Affairs Committee (@AIPAC) to discuss the importance of the U.S.â€“Israel relationship!

I introduced H.R. 3811, the Veterans Mental & Behavioral Health Quality of Care Act. This bipartisan bill aims to ensure that veterans are getting the best quality care by comparing care received within & outside of the Dept. of Veterans Affairs system. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦
Save the date! The Congressional Military Family Caucus is excited to announce that the 2023 Military Family Summit will take place on Tuesday, August 8th in Columbus, Georgia!

On June 6, 1944, more than 130K Allied troops converged on the beaches of Normandy. Today, we remember the brave soldiers who stormed the beaches & attacked from the air, helping Allied forces breach enemy defenses and began the liberation of Western Europe from Nazi occupation.

This #MemorialDay, we remember America's military service members who have died in the line of duty. As we gather with friends & family today, let us remember all that the men & women of the U.S. Armed Forces have sacrificed to keep liberty & the American Dream alive for us all.

Today, I'm happy to announce $164 million in USDA awards for projects across Southwest GA. These investments will help make healthcare better & keep it close to home, help law enforcement keep our communities safe & improve the electrical grid.
bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

(2/2) Notwithstanding her rocky upbringing in rural Tennessee during the 1950s and 1960s, Tina showed us all how to overcome adversity and turn it into opportunity and success. Tina Turner will without a doubt go down in music history as simply The Best.

(1/2) Today, the world lost The Queen of Rock and Roll & 1 of the greatest singers of all time, Tina Turner. Using her soulful voice, she combined Soul, R&B, & Rock & Roll to form her own unique style, recording countless hits that inspired ppl of all ages for over 60 years.

Mental illness affects millions of Americans, often going unseen & untreated. Stay ahead of your mental health by talking to a professional before mild symptoms intensify. If you or a loved one is experiencing a mental health crisis, contact the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline at 988.

I opposed the Majority's FY24 Ag Appropriations bill. The federal gov't should be a strong partner for small towns whose budgets can't meet the upfront costs of vital projects. Cuts will hurt the most vulnerable & blunt progress made to grow our economy. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

The bill that Republicans approved out of the House Appropriations MilCon-VA subcommittee fails to honor the Subcommitteeâ€™s responsibility to support our veterans, servicemembers & their families. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Today, I led committee approval of the Beagle Brigade Act, which will authorize the Natl Detector Dog Training Center. It trains detector dogs & US CBP handlers to sniff out prohibited ag items that could carry foreign pests & diseases into our country. piped.video/watch?v=uYcYZAQqâ€¦

Today, I met w/ LG John Healy, Chief of the @USAFReserve. We discussed how Congress can support our brave men & women and ensure they have the resources to protect us. I'm honored to represent Air Force Reserve HQ at Robins AF Base & look forward to our continued partnership.

Happy #NationalTeacherAppreciationWeek! One dedicated teacher can change the course of a young personâ€™s life. Thank you to America's teachers who go above & beyond to provide our children with an education that will be the foundation for their life's success.

Happy #NationalNursesDay & the beginning of Natl Nurses Week! Nursing is a cornerstone of health care in America & I will continue to support workforce training programs so that our communities have the nurses they need.

Diversity is one of our greatest strengths & that's why Iâ€™m proud to celebrate #AAPIHeritageMonth. Our Great American Melting Pot is stronger today because of the tremendous contributions of Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders.

Today marks the #NationalDayofPrayer, which acknowledges the role that prayer plays in the lives of many Americans. Some pray as a source of comfort, hope, strength, meditation, or religious service. As I commemorate this day, I give thanks for Godâ€™s blessings on our nation.

Recently, I met with representatives from @GABeverage which represents soft drink bottlers across the state, including Georgia's own, Coca-Cola. We discussed the upcoming Farm Bill, supply chain challenges, and how to keep plastic pollution out of our environment.

The SBA, USDA & FDIC provide funding & loans, marketing & technical assistance & other essential resources for our local entrepreneurs, small farmers & ranchers â€“ crucial investments in the small businesses which are the backbone of our economy. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

We are fortunate to have had so many students participate in this competition. I want to thank our schools, art faculties, @albanyartmuseum, and parents who all play such an important role in our students' lives and helped make this event a success. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Last week, I had the pleasure of meeting w/ @boyscouts leadership and 15 Scouts from across America. Scouting has shaped my life & the lives of millions for over 100 yrs by instilling the principles of moral character, responsibility, leadership & service to others.

Yesterday, I met with the @Commpharmacy to talk about the work that Congress and pharmacists are doing to help make sure Georgianâ€™s have access to affordable prescription drugs close to home, especially in our rural and underserved communities.

Happy 75th Birthday to the Air Force Reserve! The men and women of the Reserve represent the best of us. They dedicate themselves to maintaining a top-quality level of readiness and skill. The Reserve, active duty, and Guard blend seamlessly together to â€œFly, Fight, and Win!â€

May 14th marks the 75th anniversary of Israelâ€™s establishment. Yom Haâ€™atzmaut, Israelâ€™s Independence Day, is celebrated in Israel according to the Hebrew calendar on 4/26. The US has stood united w/ Israel to keep both nations safe & secure. Cheers to our enduring friendship!
Last week in DC, I met with the Food Industry Association @FMI_ORG to talk about how industry and the Food and Drug Administration can help ensure food safety and protect public health.
Tomorrow is the last day to submit artwork for the Congressional Art Competition!

Last week, I met with the Shippers Coalition to discuss efforts by Congress and industry to strengthen supply chains, improve freight transportation, promote safety, optimize fuel use and reduce traffic.
Happy Birthday to the Army Reserve! Thank you for your service.

I had the pleasure of attending the Mayhaw Festival in beautiful Colquitt, GA. Along with celebrating the seasonal berry known for creating delicious mayhaw jam, the Colquitt-Miller Chamber of Commerce organized a fantastic day for everyone to enjoy!

Celebrate #EarthDay by giving thanks to Mother Earth who provides us w/ food, medicine, materials to build & natural wonders like the Grand Canyon. Let's be good stewards of the land & ensure the Earthâ€™s bounty is protected for our childrenâ€™s health & enjoyment.

It was wonderful meeting with @4H participants â€“ including those from Georgia â€“ who were in Washington, DC to meet with their Senators and Representatives. These inspiring youth are building steppingstones to a brighter future for our country!

Yesterday, I discussed the federal budget for Air Force/Space Force military construction. Congress must ensure our troops & their families have safe, adequate housing + ensure that hazardous materials, like PFAS, are cleaned up from our military bases. piped.video/3xAsq2IeOVM
I was happy to welcome the @MachinistsUnion this week for a discussion about the upcoming Farm Bill and how sugarcane manufacturing is an important part of our agriculture industry.

It was great meeting with @Georgia_EMC today to talk about how EMCs are powering our state. The Inflation Reduction Act includes $9.7 billion through @USDA to help support rural EMCs transition to renewable energy for more & cleaner options that can lower energy costs.

Today Reps Cathy McMorris Rodgers, Andy Kim, & I introduced a resolution to designate April as the Month of the Military Child. I will continue to work in Congress to support our military children so that our troops can rest assured while they defend us. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Today marks #NationalLibrarianDay. Librarians are highly skilled professionals who work hard to ensure that reading materials & online media are accurate & accessible to every community. If you havenâ€™t already, visit your local library to see what services they have to offer!

Today the MLB celebrates #JackieRobinsonDay. A proud son of Cairo, GA, his amazing athleticism was matched by his courage in the face of bigotry, which helped integrate baseball. Though his 42 may be retired, his legacy lives on!

April 22-30 is #NationalParkWeek! Park entrance fees will be waived on April 22. GA's 2nd District is home to 3 beautiful National Parks: Jimmy Carter National Historic Park, Andersonville Historic Site & Ocmulgee Mounds Historic Park. Get out & enjoy! nps.gov/subjects/npscelebratâ€¦

This February, after more than a decade of bipartisan work to get a fairer playing field for our pecan producers, @RepDavidScott, @RepAustinScott and I were glad to see India reduce its tariffs on U.S. pecan exports by 70%. #NationalPecanDay

Each year, GA produces 100 million lbs of pecans w/ most production in Dougherty Co. Not only are these nuts good for our economy-they help provide nutrients for a healthy diet. On #NationalPecanDay we celebrate all that farmers do to keep GA the number one pecan producer.

Today is the 75th anniversary of the @USAFReserve. Headquartered at Robins Air Force Base in GAâ€™s 2nd Congressional District, the Air Force Reserveâ€™s mission is to provide combat ready forces to fly, fight & win whenever duty calls. Happy Birthday to the US Air Force Reserve!

Expectant Black mothers in the US can be up to 3x more likely to die from pregnancy-related causes. This is a challenge we can and must overcome. I'll continue to support programs that improve maternal health through housing, transportation & nutrition. #BlackMaternalHealthWeek

One of the best investments we can make in the future of our community is our children & I'm glad to announce 4 grants totaling $21,102,507 to Enrichment Services Program in Columbus, GA for its Head Start and Early Head Start programs. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce the Crawford County Commission is receiving a $223,600 grant from the US Department of Homeland Security to help them increase/maintain the number of trained, front line firefighters available in their communities. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm excited to announce that my office is now accepting entries for this yearâ€™s Congressional Art Competition. This district-wide competition is a tremendous opportunity to showcase the considerable talent of GA's 2nd Districtâ€™s high school students! bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce a federal award for improvements to Paradise Park in Thomasville! I will continue to work to provide GA02 cities with the resources they need to improve their facilities without placing additional strain on their budgets. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm pleased to announce 3 federal awards totaling $7.2 million to primary healthcare clinics in Blakely, Macon & Albany to help improve and expand healthcare services across Middle & Southwest GA!
 bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Today, we commemorate #GoldStarSpousesDay to honor the sacrifices made by spouses of service members who lost their lives in the line of duty. Our nation is forever indebted to these brave soldiers & their surviving spouses who gave so much in service to their country.

I had the pleasure of meeting with Col. Jeremy Chapman & Peter Taylor of the US Army Corps of Engineers to discuss the hydrilla issue at Lake Seminole & the partnership between Congress & the Corps to improve operations along the Chattahoochee River.

Last week, I met with Mayor Kelvin Owens of Camilla & the @leagueofcities. I will continue to work hard in Congress to ensure federal programs have the resources to support small towns & cities so they can affordably provide fundamental utilities, good education, & safe streets.

Today, I presented a check to @RCICaregiving which represents $1,020,047 in funding I secured in the FY23 funding bill. It will be used to expand support for GA Alzheimer's caregivers through RCIâ€™s Dealing with Dementia program.
bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

On Tuesday, GA Dept of Community Affairs Commissioner Nunn & I discussed the importance of the partnership between GAâ€™s DCA & the federal government in providing robust funding to build affordable housing, improve our infrastructure & spur economic development across our state.

Today is #NationalVietnamWarVeteransDay. More than 7 million veterans served in the Armed Forces during the Vietnam War. They served w/ tremendous courage during one of the most challenging eras in history. We also remember the 57,939 veterans who made the ultimate sacrifice.

Today at 1pm, Iâ€™ll be leading my colleagues on the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration & Related Agencies for a FY24 budget hearing with FDA Commissioner, Dr. Robert Califf. Tune in below! piped.video/watch?v=Ih4sP6e1â€¦

Applications are currently open & must be submitted by June 2nd. To apply & receive additional info for the Emergency Relief Program please visit fsa.usda.gov/programs-and-seâ€¦. For the Pandemic Assistance Revenue Program application please visit farmers.gov/coronavirus/pandâ€¦ .

USDA is providing revenue-based disaster & pandemic assistance programs for ag producers who suffered financial losses in '20 or '21 from natural disasters or COVID. There are 2 programs are being offered: Emergency Relief Program Phase 2 and Pandemic Assistance Revenue Program.

Happy National Ag Day! Itâ€™s not too late to be counted in the 2022 Census of Agriculture! #AgCensus data are used by those who serve farmers and U.S. agriculture. Donâ€™t miss your opportunity to be represented in this vital, widely used data! #AgDay23 nass.usda.gov/AgCensus

I joined Mayor Dorough & Dougherty County leaders to officially open the new Albany Transportation Center â€“ a 2 decade project that broke ground in 2021. Iâ€™m pleased to highlight that the federal government provided 80% of the funds needed to complete this $11.5 million project.

Last Friday, I was in Macon for the 41st International Cherry Blossom Festival - a celebration of the city's beautiful Yoshino cherry trees. This year's festival included visitors from Japan & Ireland, demonstrating the festivalâ€™s theme of Love, Beauty & International Friendship.

Those interested should submit their applications by April 11th. To apply for these REACH program grants and obtain more information on eligibility please visit the link below. grants.gov/web/grants/view-oâ€¦

GRANT ANNOUNCEMENT: The REACH program seeks to improve health, prevent diseases & reduce health disparities among ethnic groups w/ the highest risk of chronic disease. Programming includes improving nutrition, exercise & promoting the importance of immunizations.

I am proud to celebrate March as #NationalPeanutMonth! GA farmers supply half of Americaâ€™s peanuts which contain fiber, protein & good fats which help us sustain energy throughout the day. Please join me in recognizing the GA producers who work hard every day to feed the world.

On March 23, the @usdafsa in GA will host a New & Beginning Farmer Resources Workshop from 1-4pm. This will be a great opp to hear from leadership on what programs may benefit ag producers. Those interested may attend in-person or virtually & should email Ansley.Hatcher@usda.gov.

Yesterday, I visited Colquitt, GA to celebrate an award of $161,167 that I secured as part of the FY23 federal funding bill. These federal funds will help upgrade the 911 consoles at the Miller-Baker Emergency Communications Center. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

In 1919 soldiers of the American Expeditionary Forces in Paris formed the American Legion. Today, the Legion is America's largest VSO & it continues to support veterans & military families through local community programs & advocacy. Happy 104th Birthday to the @AmericanLegion!

Today I was at International Studies Elementary Charter School in Albany to join @USDA & @georgiadeptofed in announcing an agreement that would strengthen the supply chain for school meal programs by increasing the purchasing of nutritious, local foods. ams.usda.gov/press-release/uâ€¦

It's #NationalSchoolBreakfastWeek! Hunger leads to behavior problems & lower grades in class. Kids who regularly eat breakfast show improved concentration & learning. In Congress, I'll continue to support programs like the School Breakfast Program & National School Lunch Program.

Today, I introduced H.R. 1480, the Beagle Brigade Act, in the U.S. House. This bipartisan bill would provide permanent authorization for the National Detector Dog Training Center located in Newnan, GA. Read more below! bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Today at 10am ET, Iâ€™ll be leading my colleagues on the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Ag, Rural Development, Food & Drug Administration & Related Agencies for a public oversight hearing w/ the US Dept of Ag Office of Inspector General. Tune in below! piped.video/live/Gbe5QzJZvBgâ€¦

I'm glad to continue my work on the House Ag Committee in the 118th Congress as we craft the upcoming Farm Bill. These federal programs affect the lives of every American & ensure that we have the finest, safest & most abundant food, fiber & medicine. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Happy #InternationalWomensDay! Iâ€™ll single out a very special woman from SW GA, Rosalynn Carter. Born & raised in Plains, First Lady Carter is the founder of the Institute for Caregivers, co-founder of the Carter Center & is a longtime advocate for affordable housing & families.

I'm pleased to announce that the Georgia Rural Water Association is the recipient of a $1.2 million grant from FEMA to purchase emergency equipment for water & wastewater facilities throughout GA. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Yesterday, I supported H.R. 815, the Removing Extraneous Loopholes Insuring Every Veteran Emergency (RELIEVE) Act. Our vets shouldn't second-guess seeking emergency medical care out of fear of costly bills when they enroll in the VA health care system. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

The Macon-Bibb County Economic Opportunity Council is being awarded nearly $4 million under the federal Head Start Program through the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services!
bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm pleased to announce a $222K Rural Decentralized Water Systems grant to the Golden Triangle Resource Conservation & Development Council. The grant is part of USDA's Rural Development program & will help finance direct loans for water well installments. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm excited to announce that @FVSU will receive a $2.9 million Connecting Minority Communities Program grant from the National Institute of Standards & Technology Bureau to update and expand broadband technologies in the region. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

I'm happy to announce two federal awards to Blakely, GA totaling $376,500 to allow the city to purchase a new grapple truck & garbage truck. I am glad to see these federal funds coming to Blakely to help ensure uninterrupted services for its residents. bishop.house.gov/media-centeâ€¦

Earlier this week, I met with the President & CEO of the Boys & Girls Club of Macon. We discussed how Congress can support our youth outside of school time by fully funding federal programs, such as 21st Century Community Learning Centers & the DoJ Natl Youth Mentoring Program.

On Tuesday, I was happy to meet with representatives from the Southern Cotton Growers in Washington, DC. Georgia is a powerhouse in cotton production in the United States (#2!),  producing 2.6 million bales last year.

(5/5) This horrific chapter in history is a painful reminder of the injustices faced by Black Americans across the South. This #BlackHistoryMonth it's important that our communities are informed of our past & the struggle for equality & dignity of African Americans everywhere.

(4/5) The freedmen were met in Camilla by the local sheriff & White vigilantes who opened fire on them, killing a dozen and wounding countless more. The following months saw continued violence & voter intimidation by White vigilantes who wished to solidify their political power.

(3/5) The White-dominated legislature expelled them all, arguing that Blacks had the right to vote but not hold elected office. In response, several hundred freedmen marched from Albany to the Mitchell County courthouse in Camilla to rally against this disenfranchisement.

(2/5) GA was readmitted to the Union in 1868 amid the Reconstruction Era following the Civil War. Under the new Constitution of the state of Georgia, African Americans were allowed the right to vote, leading to the election of nearly 30 Black legislators to the state legislature.

#BHMðŸ§µ(1/5) Recently, the city of Camilla unveiled a new historical marker at the Mitchell County Courthouse to commemorate the Camilla Massacre, one of the most violent events of Georgiaâ€™s Reconstruction Era.

One year ago today, Russia launched its unlawful and unprovoked war against Ukraine. The United States and our allies stand firm with the Ukrainian people as they continue to fight to defend their independence and right to self-government.

Projects like this, and the $1M in FY22 federal funds I secured for Bainbridge, will help the city bring new businesses & opportunities to the area without saddling local governments & residents with huge, up-front capital improvement costs.

High-speed internet is fundamental to so many things in our day-to-day lives from resources that our students and teachers use to connecting doctors with patients. I was proud to specifically secure these funds for Donalsonville as part of the FY 2023 Appropriations bill.
Earlier this month, I was in Donalsonville to celebrate $562,490 in federal funds to help expand high-speed internet to 1,200 households in Seminole County!

I was proud to secure these funds as part of the FY2023 federal funding bill, and I am happy to see the work I do in Washington coming home to Southwest Georgia to help make life better for our community. I look forward to visiting again to see this project completed.

Recently, I was in Colquitt, GA to celebrate $1,187,200 in federal funds for the city to make improvements to its water and wastewater systems so that the community continues to have affordable, clean water.

(4/4) My wife, Vivian, and I send our deepest condolences to Tommyâ€™s wife, Carole, and their family as they mourn the loss of this stalwart advocate and leader. Our thoughts and prayers will remain with them in the days, weeks, and months ahead.

(3/4) He was a pillar of the 100 Black Men of America, where he improved the lives of so many through his mentorship of young African Americans. So many will feel this loss, but Tommyâ€™s immeasurable contributions to GA & our nation will live on through the lives he has touched.

(2/4) Tommy was a graduate of @FVSU & would eventually become the founder & Chairman of the  National Black College Alumni Hall of Fame Foundation. In 1978, Tommy began serving as an aide for U.S. Senator Sam Nunn, rising to become the first Black State Director in U.S. history.

(1/4) Yesterday, GA lost a trailblazing leader, businessman & my friend of longstanding, Thomas Dortch, Jr. I had the honor of working w/ Tommy during my time in the GA General Assembly & as a Member of Congress to ensure justice, equity & good quality of life for all Americans.
Georgia wouldn't have become #1 in peanut production without the immeasurable contributions and research of Dr. Carver!

(4/4) Douglass was never sure of his exact birthday or age, but he chose to celebrate every year on February 14th. This #BlackHistoryMonth, let us remember the life and legacy of Frederick Douglass and his courageous activism amid great adversity.
(3/4) Throughout his life, he published three autobiographies and was a skilled orator who delivered dozens of speeches in support of abolition, suffrage, and equality for women and people of color.
(2/4) He bravely escaped his captors in 1838 and settled in Massachusetts where he would start a family and become a renowned anti-slavery activist before and during the Civil War.
(1/4) Happy #FrederickDouglassDay! Frederick Douglass was an American abolitionist leader, public speaker and author who was born into slavery in Maryland in 1818.

(3/3) This #BlackHistoryMonth, we recognize Miss Bea Borders for her selfless work and dedication to generations of African Americans.

(2/3) During her decades as a midwife, Miss Bea helped deliver over 6,000 babies, taking little or no payment for her work. This facility is known as the Georgia B. Williams Nursing Home and is the only known birthing center of its kind for Black women during the Jim Crow era.

(1/3) During the mid-20th Century, pregnant Black women had few health care options in Southwest Georgia. In the 1940s, Camilla, GA midwife, Beatrice Borders, opened her home as a facility where Black mothers could safely bring children into the world.

(3/3) This #BlackHistoryMonth let us remember those who fought for, shed blood for & lost their lives in pursuit of this sacred franchise.

(2/3) However, southern states continued to disenfranchise Black men through poll taxes, literacy tests, violence & intimidation. Voting rights for all Black Americans would not become a reality until the passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965, 95 years later.

(1/3) 153 years ago today, the #FifteenAmendment to the Constitution was ratified. This prohibited the federal government & the states from denying a citizenâ€™s right to vote on account of race, color, or previous condition of servitude.

(3/3) After 5 months of protests, the Greensboro Woolworth relented and served 3 Black customers. This seemingly small accomplishment inspired a radical change in the Jim Crow South and helped move America towards the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

(2/3) On this day in 1960, 4 Black college students, known as the #GreensboroFour, sat down at the whites-only Woolworth lunch counter and asked to be served, sparking a nationwide movement of non-violent sit-ins.
(1/3) #BlackHistoryMonth is a time to reflect on the enormous contributions African Americans have made that have played a central role in shaping the history & culture of our nation.

On January 31, 1940, the US Treasury issued the first #SocialSecurity check. Before SS, nearly 50% of seniors lived in poverty. Today, this earned benefit supports 66 million Americans. I will continue to work hard in Congress to ensure that Social Security is protected.

I enjoyed meeting with Chandler, a nurse practitioner from Columbus, GA. She visited Congress with @AANP_NEWS to discuss how NPs help provide important medical care. I will always work in Congress to support training the medical professionals needed to keep Americans healthy.

You can still enroll in an #ACA healthcare plan for 2023! Be sure to sign up by Jan. 15th for coverage starting Feb. 1st. This year, thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act, Americans can continue to get help with premiums and save an average of $800 per year & $2,400 per family.
